title: 1901–02 in Belgian football
text:
The 1901–02 season was the seventh competitive season in <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a>.
Overview.
Only one official division existed at the time, split into two leagues. It was called "Coupe de Championnat" (Championship Cup) and its winner was decided after a final round between the first two of each league, for the first time in the championship history.
The season was not completed in Championship Cup A, and <a href="Skill%20F.C.%20de%20Bruxelles">Skill F.C. de Bruxelles</a> withdrew at the end of the season. No teams were admitted.
